alert.note: Alert for Mecklenburg (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 12 at 7:16AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Mecklenburg County in the piedmont of North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 1030 AM EST. * IMPACTS...River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 710 AM EST, High levels of runoff were keeping stream levels elevated, and above bankfull in spots, across the Mallard Creek basin. Flooding of low-lying areas will linger this morning, especially near the PNC Music Pavilion parking lots and along Pavilion Blvd. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Northeast Charlotte, Harrisburg and University City. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
